forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 54, with temperatures rising to around 57 overnight. South southwest wind 12 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 8am. Mostly cloudy. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight softly blankets Downtown San Francisco, the evening air carries a heavy promise of rain. The city sits under a woolly, cloud-laden sky, with a palpable chill just above the horizon. The temperature is hovering around a cool 54 degrees, with an uptick toward 57 as the night deepens. A formidable south-southwest wind is making its presence felt, brushing against the buildings and swirling through the streets, creating a scene that invites both reflection and introspection as gusts reach upward of 31 mph. Expect the promise of rain to unfold in earnest tonight, with a 90 percent chance of precipitation; droplets are likely to vary between three-quarters of an inch to an inch, further dampening the festive echoes of the day.

As Friday dawns, the uncertainty of rain lingers until morning breaks, shifting to a 30 percent chance of showers before 8 AM. The day may still grapple with stubborn clouds, veiling the sun from cloistered facets of the city. With highs reaching a gentle 60 before cascading into cooler afternoon temperatures around 56, a brisk west wind at 9 to 15 mph will accompany your explorations, swirling the cool, crisp air around you. Embrace the weather by wrapping yourself in layers; a comfortable sweater or light jacket combined with sturdy footwear will keep you warm and ready to face the elements. With city streets glistening from the night's rain, consider a leisurely stroll through the Presidio or along the waterfront, pausing perhaps at a cozy café for a warm drink as you watch the clouds play with the light.
